flannel noun
(CLOTHING)
[ U ] a light cloth usually made from wool, used especially for making trousers, skirts, or suits : He was wearing a grey flannel suit. flannels [ plural ]
trousers made of light wool cloth: Traditionally, white flannels are worn when playing cricket.
[ U ] mainly US a soft cloth made from cotton, used for making shirts and pyjamas: He was dressed in jeans and a ragged flannel shirt. an old flannel nightshirt Synonym
flannelette
[ C ] US a shirt made out of this soft cloth: The owner wore a light blue flannel and designer jeans.

flannel noun
(UNNECESSARY WORDS)
[ U ] UK informal speech containing a lot of words that is used to avoid telling the truth or answering a question, and is often intended to deceive: Leave out the flannel and answer the question!
